title: A.T. Cross Company Announces Executive Leadership Changes

Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 00:09 BST - UK Markets open in 7 hrs 51 mins A.T. Cross Company Announces Executive Leadership Changes Press Release : A.T. Cross Company – 36 minutes ago 
LINCOLN, R.I.--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- 
-Robert P. Baird, Jr. Named as its new Chief Executive Officer 
The Board of Directors of A.T. Cross Company (“A.T. Cross” or the “Company”), a portfolio company of Clarion Capital Partners, announced today that Robert P. Baird, Jr. has been appointed as the Company’s new Chief Executive Officer. Chad Mellen is stepping down from his executive positions to pursue other business opportunities. 
“A.T. Cross is embarking on an exciting new branding strategy to reach expressive consumers all over the world,” commented Eric Kogan, A.T. Cross’s Chairman. “The Board is pleased to have found a terrific leader to aggressively move the Cross and Sheaffer brands forward into our fast moving contemporary world." 
Robert (“Bob”) Baird is a proven brand and team builder with a highly diverse consumer products background. Most recently Bob was the CEO and President of the Sports portfolio of Dorel Industries, a $1.1 billion in revenue global business which included such major brands as Cannondale, Schwinn, GT, Mongoose, Caloi, and the Sugoi apparel brand. Bob led the Sports division to 13 consecutive quarters of profit growth, and drove sales from $640 million to over $1 billion. Prior to Dorel, Bob was the President and CEO of the North American Domestic Appliance business of Royal Philips Electronics, responsible for brands such as Norelco and Sonicare. Bob reversed years of market share declines, and grew revenues and earnings while garnering the highest employee engagement scores across Philips’ consumer businesses. Bob also was the General Manager of the $250 million in revenue North American, soft-sided luggage business of Samsonite Corporation. 
Bob spent the early part of his career in financial and brand management roles with global companies such as General Electric, Procter & Gamble, Bristol Myers Squibb, and General Motors in the Cadillac Division. 
Bob holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Economics from St. Lawrence University, and a Masters of Business Administration in Marketing, Finance, and Management Policy from the Kellogg School at Northwestern University. Bob is the Chairman of the U.S. Board of SOS Children’s Villages, the world’s leading charitable organization providing orphaned and abandoned children with loving homes. 
"I'm grateful to the Board for the opportunity to lead this exceptional organization of creative, dedicated and talented professionals," said Baird. "A.T. Cross produces elegantly designed writing instruments and accessories that inspire writers around the globe. I’m excited to meet our employees, customers, distributors, and suppliers over the coming months to collaborate on our future, and look forward to leading this company to its next period of superb performance.” 
Chad Mellen has agreed to serve as a special advisor to the company to assist with the transition. 
"I want to thank Chad Mellen for his loyal dedication to A.T. Cross for the past 10 years,” Mr. Kogan said. “He has shown genuine commitment to the Company and passion for the importance of written expression all over the world. The Board of Directors wishes him well as he pursues new endeavors.” 
Chad Mellen commented, “A.T. Cross is a cherished American brand with a dedicated global workforce. I am proud of the accomplishments of the last ten years, including transitioning A.T. Cross to becoming an independent company, and wish the Company continued success in the future. I look forward to assisting the Company with a smooth transition.” 
About A.T. Cross Company 
Founded in 1846, the A.T. Cross Company has helped generations of consumers celebrate signature moments with its award-winning quality writing instruments, journals, timepieces, non-prescription reading glasses and business accessories. Cross products are sold in 89 countries through fine department and specialty stores as well as through the corporate gift channel. For more information, please visit the A.T.
